If the previous term is odd, the next term is 3 times the previous term plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequence will always reach 1. Note: 1. <|endoftext|>/*
Given a grid with N rows and N columns (N >= 2) and a positive integer k, 
each cell of the grid contains a value. Every integer in the range {1, N * N}
inclusive appears exactly once on the cells of the grid.

You have to find the minimum path of length k in the grid. You can start
from any cell, and in each step you can move to any of the neighbor cells,
in other words, you can go to cells which share an edge with you current
cell.
Please note that a path of length k means visiting exactly k cells (not
necessarily distinct).
You CANNOT go off the grid.
A path A (of length k) is considered less than a path B (of length k) if
after making the ordered vectors of the values on the cells that A and B go

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is an alphabetical character and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("")  false 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char chr = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
    while (false) {
        if (txt.length() == 1) return true;
        }
   
    if (chr >= 'a' && chr <= 'z') return true;
    if (chr >= 'A' && chr <= 'Z') return true;
    return false;
}

/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is a digit and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("")  false 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_digit(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char chr = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
    while (false) {
        if (txt.length() == 1) return true;
        }
   
    if (chr >= '0' && chr <= '9') return true;
    return false;
}

/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is a punctuation mark and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation("")  false 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_punctuation(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char chr = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
    while (false) {
        if (txt.length() == 1) return true;
        }
   
    if (chr >= '!' && chr <= '?') return true;
    if (chr >= '.' && chr <= ',') return true;
    if (chr >= ';' && chr <= '@') return true;
    if (chr >= '[' && chr <= '`') return true;
    if (chr >= '~' && chr <= '`') return true;
    return false;
}

Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

check_if_last_char_is_a_word("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_word("")  false 
*/

#include <string>
using std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_word(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char chr = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
    while (false) {
        if (txt.length() == 1) return true;
        }
   
    if (chr >= 'a' && chr <= 'z') return true;
    if (chr >= 'A' && chr <= 'Z') return true;
    if (chr >= '0' && chr <= '9') return true;
    if (chr >= '!' && chr <= '?') return true;
    if (chr >= '.' && chr <= ',') return true;
    if (chr >= ';' && chr <= '@') return true;
    if (chr >= '[' && chr <= '`') return true;
    if (chr >= '~' && chr <= '`') return true;
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_even(int n) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        sum += i;
    }
    
    return sum % 2 == 0;
}

/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive odd numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_odd(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_odd(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_odd(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_odd(int n) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        sum += i;
    }
    
    return sum % 2!= 0;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1,bfact=1;
    for (int i=1;i<=n;i++)
        fact=fact*i;
    for (int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        bfact=bfact*i;
    }
    return fact*bfact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > all_prefixes(string str) {
    vector < string > out;
    string current = "";
   
    for (int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
        current += str[i];
        out.push_back(current);
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positive integer, obtain its roman numeral equivalent as a string,
and return it in lowercase.
Restrictions: 1 <= num <= 1000

Examples:
>>> int_to_mini_roman(19) == "xix"
>>> int_to_mini_roman(152) == "clii"
>>> int_to_mini_roman(426) == "cdxxvi"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string int_to_mini_romank(int number) {
    string current = "";
    vector < string > rep = {
        "m", "cm", "d", "cd", "c", "xc", "l", "xl", "x", "ix", "v", "iv", "i"}
    ;
    vector < int > num = {
        1000, 900, 500, 400, 100, 90, 50, 40, 10, 9, 5, 4, 1}
    ;
    int pos = 0;
    while (number > 0)
   
    {
        string temp = rep[num[pos]];
        number -= num[pos];
        current += temp;
        pos++;
    }
    return current;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positive floating point number, it can be decomposed into
and integer part (largest integer smaller than given number) and decimals
(leftover part always smaller than 1).

Return the decimal part of the number.
>>> truncate_number(3.5)
0.5
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
double truncate_number(double number) {
    double int_part;
    double decimal_part;
    int_part = floor(number);
    decimal_part = number - int_part;
    return decimal_part;
}

/*
Given a positive floating point number, it can be decomposed into
and integer part (largest integer smaller than given number) and decimals
(leftover part always smaller than 1).

Return the integer part of the number.
>>> truncate_number(3.5)
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
int truncate_number(double number) {
    double int_part;
    double decimal_part;
    int_part = floor(number);
    decimal_part = number - int_part;
    return int_part;
}

/*
Given a positive floating point number, it can be decomposed into
and integer part (largest integer smaller than given number) and decimals
(leftover part always smaller than 1).

Return the integer part of the number rounded to a specified precision.
>>> truncate_number(3.5, 2)
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
int truncate_number(double number, int precision) {
    double int_part;
    double decimal_part;
    int_part = floor(number);
    decimal_part = number - int_part;
    return round(decimal_part * pow(10, precision)) / pow(10, precision);
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
prime_fib returns n-th number that is a Fibonacci number and it's also prime.
>>> prime_fib(1)
2
>>> prime_fib(2)
3
>>> prime_fib(3)
5
>>> prime_fib(4)
13
>>> prime_fib(5)
89
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include <iostream>
#include <random>


using namespace std;

bool miller_rabin(long long n, int k = 10) {
    if (n < 2) {
        return false;
    }
    if (n == 2 || n == 3) {
        return true;
    }
    if (n % 2 == 0) {
        return false;
    }

    int r = 0;
    long long d = n - 1;
    while (d % 2 == 0) {
        r++;
        d /= 2;
    }

    std::random_device rd;
    std::mt19937_64 gen(rd());
    std::uniform_int_distribution<long long> dis(2, n - 2);

    for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
        long long a = dis(gen);
        long long x = 1;
        while (d > 0) {
            if (d % 2 == 1) {
                x = (x * a) % n;
            }
            d /= 2;
        }
        if (x == n) {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

int prime_fib(long long n) {
    if (n < 2) {
        return 0;
    }
    if (n == 2 || n == 3) {
        return 1;
    }
    if (n % 2 == 0) {
        return 0;
    }

    int r = 0;
    long long d = n - 1;
    while (d % 2 == 0) {
        r++;
        d /= 2;
    }

    std::random_device rd;
    std::mt19937_64 gen(rd());
    std::uniform_int_distribution<long long> dis(2, n - 2);

    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
        long long a = dis(gen);
        long long x = 1;
        while (d > 0) {
            if (d % 2 == 1) {
                x = (x * a) % n;
            }
            d /= 2;
        }
        if (x == n) {
            return r;
        }
    }
    return 0;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Change numerical base of input number x to base.
return string representation after the conversion.
base numbers are less than 10.
>>> change_base(8, 3)
"22"
>>> change_base(8, 2)
"1000"
>>> change_base(7, 2)
"111"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string change_base(int x,int base){
	if (x == 0){
		return "0";
	}
    string out="";
    int i=0;
    while(x!= 0){
        int digit = x % base;
        out += (char)digit;
        x /= base;
        i++;
    }
    return out;
}

#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
#include <algorithm>
using std;
using std::vector;
using std::sort;
using std::max;
using std::min;
using std::swap;
using std::nth_element;
using std::for_each;
using std::distance;

double median(vector<double> l) {
  sort(l.begin(), l.end());
  double mid = l[l.size()/2];
  double median = mid;
  double n = l.size();
  double sum = 0;
  double count = 0;
  for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    sum += l[i];
    if (sum >= mid) {
      count++;
    }
  }
  if (count > n/2) {
    median = mid;
  } else {
    median = l[count];
  }
  return median;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are below threshold t.
>>> below_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
true
>>> below_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool below_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] < t) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

/*
Return true if all numbers in the vector l are above threshold t.
>>> above_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
false
>>> above_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool above_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > t) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

/*

true

true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool equal_threshold(vector < int > l, int t) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] == t) {
         return true;
      }
   }
   return false;
}

>>> between({1, 2, 4, 10}, 5, 10)
true
>>> between({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5, 10)
true
>>> between({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5, 15)
false
*/

#include <vector>

bool between(vector < int > l, int t, int delta) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > t && l[i] < t+delta) {
         return true;
      }
   }
   return false;
}
